What might be "Paper"?
<br>By paper or document drawings we mean to convey that the drawings who are hand drawn on newspaper. Before the evolution and widespread using CAD all drawings were hand drawn in writing. What might be paper to CAD?
<br>There are basically two approaches you can use for paper to CAD conversion. The first and the most basic approach is to personally redraw the paper sketches. This is done by means of trained CAD drafters.

The second approach is called automatic conversion. This is complete by scanning the documents drawings into image component, and then using an important raster to vector conversions software to automatically transfer the image files in CAD format. However this process is not 100% automated and also the accuracy of the output varies derived from one of software to the various other.

What's the need with regard to paper to CAD?
<br>There is various different reasons why paper to CAD conversion is. CAD format drawings are easier to store and edit consequently they are not subject to deterioration over time as will be the case with the typical paper drawings.

tutorial complet for cad design

One within the key methods to achieving great ends in CGI is ambient occlusion (AO), it adds extra depth for a render and takes a nice image that one action further.

Once your AO shader is setup it's good to apply it to any scene. The simplest way to do this is to use a 'material override' option which is certainly under the 'processing' tab of the render setup window. Just drag your mental ray material towards the material slot in this material override section and drop an instance in there; this will now quickly apply your AO material to everything from the scene, easy! You can apply the material by selecting everything inside scene and applying the mat to everyone, but it is usually advisable do it with the particular material override as you're allowed keep all of your material settings and may just switch the AO sleeping pad off when you're executed.

One other thing to reconsider is that when you're applying this to a scene you could have already textured and lit (which is often the case) then you need to switch off/delete all the particular lights, turn off MR direct exposure control, remove any natural world maps, set the environment to white and de-activate final gather - that ambient occlusion calculation doesn't call for ANY lighting, it is using the geometry only to clear up how much shading could be in your scene so having the above on will just screw it up.

[b]Bells plus whistles:

So we have covered tips on how to do a 'pure' AO render aided by the method outlined above but there are numerous problems with that, yes it does present you with great 'connecting shadows' though since everything is black or white there is no colour bleed with the materials, also since the last AO option has basically no lighting solution (and is purely ambient) there are actually no indirect light bounces... take place we solve this?

Well firstly our scene materials need to be MR A&D mats - these could be very daunting at first but at the time you get into using them and setting up your scenes with physically correct settings you will note how versatile they tend to be. In each material you will need to scroll down the options into the 'special effects' group and in here you can get an 'ambient occlusion' setting up, once this is started up it will apply ambient occlusion on the material.

The settings resemble the other AO option in that you have a 'samples' option to stop quality and the 'max distance' placing; however, you then possess a check box to 'use colour combination from other materials (exact AO)', this is the option that gives all of us shadows with bounced lighting so, as a normal rule, I have this kind of checked. The only other thing to examine is that the 'shadow colour' is set to 'global ambient light-weight colour' - this makes sure that the shadows generated use the global settings out of your 'Environment and Effects' tab rather than custom setting per cloth.

<em>NOTE: If you are concentrating on a large scene with lots of materials in it is fairly important to get an individual's AO settings right firstly, clicking through hundreds about mats to tweak settings tend to make you lose the will to reside in! And also you could transfer these techniques right into 3D software.
